pullRequest.body:
Let `G` be a complete nonarchimedean abelian group and let `f : α → G` be a function. We prove that `f` is unconditionally summable if and only if `f a` tends to zero on the cofinite filter on `α`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: One question I have for the reviewers is what folder this file should be in (`Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.InfiniteSum.Nonarchimedean`, or `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Nonarchimedean.InfiniteSum`?) . The other is what namespace the theorems should be in (`NonarchimedeanAddGroup.summable_iff_tendsto_cofinite_zero`, or `summable_iff_tendsto_cofinite_zero`?).
I made this proof more complicated than it needs to be. I can simplify it by using `cauchySeq_finset_iff_vanishing`. I will work on this.
Thank you for the review. I have made the changes you suggest.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8567360757/job/23479002678)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8567360757/job/23479001783)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8567360757/job/23479002476)

I don't have time for a full review at the moment, but here is one comment already.

The choice of file name and namespace seems fine to me (maybe not in a namespace might be ok, but this namespace is fine if there are already other lemmas in it).
This looks very clean! LGTM, just two tiny style suggestions.

Please use `∑ x in S, f x` in the statement (`open BigOperators` to enable this notation)
Also, if the *statement* of a theorem doesn't require `DecidableEq`, please don't add it as an assumption. Instead, use `classical` as the first tactic and then `DecidableEq` will be available in the rest of the proof
Thanks! I'll keep this in mind.

```suggestion
```
Please remove blank lines in proofs (also below).

```suggestion
theorem cauchySeq_prod_of_tendsto_cofinite_one {α G : Type*} [CommGroup G] [UniformSpace G]
```
I like the new formulation using `CauchySeq`, please also update the name (and you can remove `_partial` from the name).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: convergence of infinite sums in nonarchimedean abelian groups
